for_sales.sales_text:
Purchased in 2006 and renovated over the years.

New engine, deck and lots of painting and varnishing.

Sailing History -

Built in 1978 MK1 Cornish Crabber

First ones built with GRP hull moulded from original chine shape which was a ply hull.

My husband sailed KALLISTO to South West Brittany, The Channel Isles, Southern Ireland, The Scilly Isles, The East Coast , Bristol Channel, The West Country, Solent and even the River Thames from Lechlade to Chatham Docks (without the mast)

She was traillered to Falmouth from Dorchester for the 2021 Classics Race.

Since Autumn 2021 Kallisto has not been in the water as Ray, my husband, passed away end of 2021. She has been kept under cover on the trailer used to tow her.

There has been slight damage to the bow where the anchor chain runs through as this was caused by a storm in Lulworth Cove.

Ray kept her in mint condition and spent many hours maintaining her.

She is the ideal size to sail solo, but large enough to accommodate another crew member.

Kallisto comes on the Hayling Island trailer purchased new in 2006.

Ray kept the original Notes on Rigging, Handling and Maintenance, with diagrams.

Included is a winch made specially to pull the mast up for launching from slipways .

A full inventory with photographs of exterior and interior can be provided on request.

Sold as seen she can be viewed on dry land in Dorset
